Creation timestamps: {{yes}}{{efn |Implemented in later versions as an extension}}

Last metadata change timestamps: {{no}}{{efn |name=fat-ctime |Some FAT implementations  such as in Linux  show file modification timestamp (mtime) in the metadata change timestamp (ctime) field. This timestamp is however  not updated on file metadata change.}}
Extended attributes/ Alternate data str: {{no}}{{efn |name=note-22 |Particular Installable File System drivers and operating systems may not support extended attributes on FAT12 and FAT16. The OS/2 and Windows NT filesystem drivers for FAT12 and FAT16 support extended attributes (using a "EA DATA. SF" pseudo-file to reserve the clusters allocated to them). Other filesystem drivers for other operating systems do not.}}

Stores file owner: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-14 |The f-node contains a field for a user identifier. This is not used except by OS/2 Warp Server  however.}}

POSIX file permissions: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-5 |NTFS access control lists can express any access policy possible using simple POSIX file permissions (and far more)  but use of a POSIX-like interface is not supported without an add-on such as Services for UNIX or Cygwin.}}
Security/ MAC labels: {{yes}}{{efn |As of Vista  NTFS has support for Mandatory Labels  which are used to enforce Mandatory Integrity Control.[33]}}

Extended attributes/ Alternate data str: {{yes}}{{efn |Initially  ReFS lacked support for ADS  but Server 2012 R2 and up add support for ADS on ReFS}}

Access control lists: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-33 |Access-control lists and MAC labels are layered on top of extended attributes.}}
Extended attributes/ Alternate data str: {{no}}{{efn |name=note-32 |Some operating systems implemented extended attributes as a layer over UFS1 with a parallel backing file (e.g.  FreeBSD 4.x).}}

Access control lists: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-23 |Some Installable File System drivers and operating systems may not support extended attributes  access control lists or security labels on these filesystems. Linux kernels prior to 2.6.x may either be missing support for these altogether or require a patch.}}

Checksum/ ECC: {{partial}}{{efn |name=note-34 |Metadata checksums stored since June 2015  xfsprogs version 3.2.3}}

Creation timestamps: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-31 |The local time  timezone/UTC offset  and date are derived from the time settings of the reference/single timesync source in the NDS tree.}}
Extended attributes/ Alternate data str: {{yes}}{{efn |name=note-19 |Novell calls this feature "multiple data streams". Published specifications say that NWFS allows for 16 attributes and 10 data streams  and NSS allows for unlimited quantities of both.}}{{efn |name=note-29 |Some file and directory metadata is stored on the NetWare server irrespective of whether Directory Services is installed or not  like date/time of creation  file size  purge status  etc; and some file and directory metadata is stored in NDS/eDirectory  like file/object permissions  ownership  etc.}}
{{yes}}{{efn |name=note-17 |Record Management Services (RMS) attributes include record type and size  among many others.}}
